document.docAuthor: Valente, Roberta De Melo & Júnior, Mariano Brandão Cordeiro
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Bondariella Hustache & Bondar (Coleoptera: Curculionidae), with descriptions of the first species from the Amazon and notes on natural history

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Bondariella Hustache & Bondar (Coleoptera: Curculionidae), with descriptions of the first species from the Amazon and notes on natural history

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Rostrum (male) curved, (female) strongly curved and long ( 0.8–0.9 times as long as pronotum) ( Figs. 1 , 2 A); ventrite V transversally oblong, 3.1–3.6 times wider than long (
Figs. 4
B, 5 B, 6 B, 7 B); sutural interval of the elytra with one or two rows

keyStep.paragraph:
of scales; endophallus membranous (
Figs. 4
F, 5 F, 6 F, 7 F); sternum VIII bearing six posteroventral setae (
Figs. 4
C, 5 C, 6 C, 7 C); tegmen with dorsal parameroid lobes free medially on base (
Figs. 4
E, 5 E, 6 E, 7 E).................................. 2
- Rostrum (male) almost straight, (female) straight and short ( 0.5–0.6 times as long as pronotum) (
Figs. 2
B–C, 3 A–B); ventrite V trapezoidal, 2.5–2.6 times wider than long (
Figs. 8
B, 9 B); sutural interval of the elytra with only one row of scales; endophallus sclerotized (
Figs. 8
F, 9 F); sternum VIII glabrous (
Figs. 8
C, 9 C); tegmen with dorsal parameroid lobes connected medially on base (
Figs. 8
E, 9 E).......................................................................... 5

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Sutural interval of the elytra with only one row of scales; integument reddish black with antennae, legs and female rostrum reddish brown (
Fig. 1
A); pronotal disc with small punctures, distantly spaced by 1.3 times their own diameter; body covered dorsally by elongate whitish scales (
Fig. 1
A)....................................
Bondariella ruschiana Bondar, 1942

- Sutural interval of the elytra with two rows of scales; integument evenly light reddish brown throughout (
Fig. 1
B) or dark reddish brown with thorax and head reddish black (
Fig. 2
A) or reddish black but generally variously lighter on elytra besides antennae, legs and female rostrum (
Fig. 1
C); pronotal disc with large punctures, closely spaced by 0.3–0.5 times their own diameter; body covered dorsally by spatulate (yellowish or whitish) scales (
Figs. 1
B–C, 2 A)........................ 3

3 Integument evenly light reddish brown throughout (
Fig. 1
B), generally darker on punctures of elytral striae; body covered by large yellowish spatulate scales (
Fig. 1
B); interprocoxal distance ( 1.2–1.3 times) larger than procoxal diameter; metatibae on dorsal face strongly sinuous, in male bearing a comb of long setae on distal ½...........
Bondariella torresi Bondar, 1942

- Integument variegate, dark reddish brown with thorax and head reddish black (
Fig. 2
A) or reddish black with antennae, legs, female rostrum and (variously) elytra reddish brown (
Fig. 1
C); body covered by large yellowish or narrow whitish spatulate scales; interprocoxal distance ( 0.9 times) shorter than procoxal diameter; tibae straight, lacking comb of setae............ 4

4 Integument reddish black but evidently reddish brown (lighter) on antennae, legs and female rostrum (
Fig. 1
C); elytra completely or variously reddish black, darker at least on sutural interval and on base of remaining intervals; body covered by narrow whitish spatulate scales, becoming distantly spaced and smaller dorsally; integument very apparent between scales (
Fig. 1
C); endophallus with bags of spinules (
Fig. 6
F); sternum VIII trapezoidal (
Fig. 6
C)...................................................................................................
Bondariella mucugeana
Bondar, 1949

- Integument dark reddish brown but reddish black on thorax, head and male rostrum (
Fig. 2
A); elytra generally darker on sutural interval and sometimes with a discrete darker oval spot on basal 1 / 4 of intervals I–IV (
Fig. 2
A); body covered by large yellowish spatulate scales, virtuous uniform throughout; integument almost not apparent between scales; endophallus lacking bags of spinules (
Fig. 7
F); sternum VIII semicircular (
Fig. 7
C)........................
Bondariella mimica Bondar, 1942

5 Pronotal disc with punctures more distantly spaced (distant by 0.7 times their own diameter) and with scales becoming smaller toward the disc (
Fig. 2
B); ventrite V (male) flat, not concave medially, lacking distal tufts of scales (
Fig. 8
B); median lobe ovate in shape, with strongly acute apex, endophallus weakly sclerotized (
Fig. 8
F); spiculum gastrale with furcal arms abruptly clavate at apex (
Fig. 8
D).........................................................
Bondariella rudicula
sp. nov.

- Pronotal disc with punctures closer spaced (distant by 0.4 times their own diameter), with scales subequal in length throughout (
Fig. 2
C); ventrite V (male) concave medially, lateral margin of the concavity with distal tuft of slightly longer scales (
Fig. 9
B); median lobe with sides strongly sinuous and dorsally widened, endophallus very strongly sclerotized (
Fig. 9
F); spiculum gastrale with furcal arms short and evenly widened, not clavate (
Fig. 9
D)...................
Bondariella crenata
sp. nov.
